item.title: Israeli military says it failed to protect Gaza border town on Oct. 7
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Adela Suliman, Lior Soroka
item.description: Israeli leaders are under intense public pressure to account for the security collapse that allowed Hamas militants to attack communities on the Gaza border.

item.title: U.S. will soon end its troubled Gaza pier mission, Pentagon says
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
item.description: The Pentagon’s floating pier off Gaza, announced by President Biden in March, has been sidelined several times by poor weather and rough seas.

item.title: Kenya president fires cabinet after nationwide anti-corruption protests
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Rael Ombuor
item.description: Just six weeks ago, President William Ruto was visiting the White House and basking as a top U.S. ally in Africa, but Kenya has since exploded with anti-corruption protests.

item.title: Biden administration disturbed by Modi-Putin visit during NATO summit
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, Gerry Shih
item.description: The United States is trying to build a growing alliance with India to counter China, but an independent streak complicates relations.

item.title: Buckingham Palace’s East Wing (the one with the balcony) opens to the public
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: Allowing tours of the palace’s East Wing for the first time is part of King Charles III’s ever-so-slight opening of royal residences.

item.title: Mexico’s new leader is a climate expert. Can she save an oil nation?
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Dino Grandoni, Lorena Rios
item.description: Claudia Sheinbaum is vowing to make Mexico a global leader in climate change, weaning it off fossil fuels. But she’s hemmed in by politics and a lack of money.

item.title: Outrage in China after reports of fuel tankers transporting cooking oil
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Pei-Lin Wu
item.description: Multiple investigations are underway after revelations that tanker trucks used for carrying chemicals and waste then carried edible oil — without being cleaned.

item.title: Kenyan police begin patrols, but Haiti’s gangs are unperturbed
item.dc:creator: Widlore Mérancourt, Amanda Coletta
item.description: Haitians are growing frustrated at the lack of action or an apparent plan to take on the heavily armed criminals.

item.title: Man caught trying to smuggle 104 live snakes — in his pants
item.dc:creator: Lyric Li
item.description: The man went through the “nothing to declare” line when crossing from Hong Kong into mainland China. A search found his pockets full of writhing, scaly contraband.

item.title: Britain’s new government vows to prioritize Ukraine fight
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan
item.description: John Healey, Britain’s defense chief, said the Ukraine war is as much an economic contest between Russia and the West as it is a military fight between Kyiv and Moscow.

item.title: NATO leaders move to ‘Trump-proof’ the alliance in Washington
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Emily Rauhala, Missy Ryan, John Hudson
item.description: Fears that the former president could soon be back in the White House have NATO leaders looking to lock in support for Ukraine, and the alliance itself.

item.title: U.S. to again ship 500-pound bombs to Israel, reversing suspension
item.dc:creator: John Hudson
item.description: The Biden administration will send 500-pound bombs to Israel that had been held up since May over concerns about the Rafah invasion. But 2,000-pound bombs are still under review.

item.title: Israel calls for Gaza City to evacuate, affecting hundreds of thousands
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Adela Suliman, Hajar Harb, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The United Nations said the directive urging people to flee “will only fuel mass suffering for Palestinian families.”

item.title: Russia deems Moscow Times ‘undesirable,’ putting writers, sources at risk
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: The classification forces organizations to cease operations in Russia and opens Russians who work for, fund or collaborate with them to potential prosecution.

item.title: U.K. police find wanted man after suspected triple murder by crossbow
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: Kyle Clifford, 26, was found by police in Enfield, London, on Wednesday, Hertfordshire police said in a statement.

item.title: Ukraine’s first F-16s will see combat this summer, officials say
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton
item.description: Denmark and the Netherlands have begun to transfer the F-16s they promised to Ukraine, while Belgium and Norway said they would supply others.

item.title: Will the Paris Olympics be the friendliest yet for competing moms?
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: For the first time, the Olympic Village will feature a nursery where parents can leave their babies. France is also making accommodations for breastfeeding mothers.

item.title: Russia recruits sympathizers online for sabotage in Europe, officials say
item.dc:creator: Souad Mekhennet, Catherine Belton, Emily Rauhala, Shane Harris
item.description: Europe has been grappling with an increase in Moscow-led sabotage attacks as Russia turns its focus to increasing the cost of Western support for Ukraine.

item.title: Russia orders arrest of Yulia Navalnaya, widow of Putin’s nemesis
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina, Natalia Abbakumova
item.description: Russia’s decision to issue an arrest warrant for Navalnaya on the same day India’s prime minister was visiting Moscow sent a loud message to Putin’s critics, including in Washington.

item.title: Cypress Hill brings 28-year-old ‘Simpsons’ joke to life with London orchestra
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: Decades later, a joke on “The Simpsons” will come true — with hip-hop group Cypress Hill performing with the London Symphony Orchestra for an “insane” show.

item.title: As fears mount of an Israel-Lebanon war, Hezbollah’s arsenal looms large
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Samuel Granados
item.description: The Lebanese militant group has guided and unguided rockets, antitank artillery, and ballistic and anti-ship missiles, as well as drones equipped with explosives.

item.title: At NATO summit, Gaza is the elephant in the room
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: War rages in Ukraine and across the Middle East. But at this week’s NATO summit, it’s unlikely Gaza will draw much attention.

item.title: U.S. to provide more air defenses after missile strike on Kyiv children’s hospital
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Anastacia Galouchka, Rachel Pannett
item.description: Young patients were to be sent to Germany after a Russian missile strike on the Okhmatdyt children’s hospital, in which two people, including a doctor, were killed.

item.title: NATO vows lasting support for Ukraine but won’t promise membership
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, Michael Birnbaum, Emily Rauhala, Ellen Nakashima
item.description: Admitting Ukraine into the alliance remains a contentious subject. Some NATO members fear absorbing a country mired in conflict with a nuclear superpower.

item.title: Renewed Israeli offensive sees Gaza City health care crumble
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Hazem Balousha, Sarah Dadouch, Kareem Fahim
item.description: Fighting in the north hinders hospitals, while an airstrike in central Gaza led to at least 17 deaths, according to local officials.
